twcore.core.game
Class Ship

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Thread
      twcore.core.game.Ship
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class Ship
extends java.lang.Thread

Representation of the bot as as a Subspace ship for in-game playing.

Author:
harvey

Constructor Detail

Ship

public Ship(java.lang.ThreadGroup group,
            GamePacketGenerator gen)
Create a new instance of the Ship class (a separate program Thread).

Parameters:
group - Thread grouping to add this new thread to
gen - For generating appropriate position packets
Method Detail

typeToConstant

public static byte typeToConstant(byte shipType)
Converts a ship type from the 1-8, 0 is spec format used in Player's getShipType() method to the 0-7, 8 is spec format of the constants.

Parameters:
shipType - the old style ship type to convert
Returns:
the adjusted ship type value

run

public void run()
Regularly checks to make updates to position by way of sending a new position packet. If the ship isn't moving, it doesn't need to be updated quite as often as a moving ship. Default regularity of updates is 100ms and 1000ms for moving and unmoving ships, respectively. Set update times either hard in the code, or with setUpdateTime()

Specified by:
run in interface java.lang.Runnable
Overrides:
run in class java.lang.Thread

updatePosition

public void updatePosition()
Updates the ship's position based on current location and velocity. If a position packet should be sent, sends one.

needsToBeSent

public boolean needsToBeSent()
Returns whether or not a position packet needs to be sent. If the velocity has changed, the direction the ship is facing has changed, or the time since the last packet update is greater than or equal to the update interval for an unmoving ship, this method will return true.

Returns:
True if a position packet needs to be sent

sendPositionPacket

public void sendPositionPacket()
Generates a position packet for the ship, without weapon data.

fire

public void fire(int weapon)
Generates a position packet for the ship, and fires the weapon specified. Refer to the getWeaponNumber method for proper setup of a weapon.

Parameters:
weapon - A 16-bit bitvector containing weapon information
See Also:
getWeaponNumber(byte, byte, boolean, boolean, boolean, byte, boolean)

move

public void move(int direction,
                 int x,
                 int y,
                 int xVel,
                 int yVel,
                 int togglables,
                 int energy,
                 int bounty)
Sets various ship-related fields (not all are movement-related), and then sends a position packet.

Parameters:
direction - Direction to face ship, in Subspace degrees (0-39)
x - X location on the map (0-16384)
y - Y location on the map (0-16384)
xVel - Velocity along the x axis (# pixels across x every 10 seconds)
yVel - Velocity along the y axis (# pixels across y every 10 seconds)
togglables - Size 8 bitvector containing stealth, cloak, x, anti, safety, ufo data
energy - Player's current energy
bounty - Player's current bounty

move

public void move(int x,
                 int y,
                 int xVel,
                 int yVel)
Sets some movement-related fields for the bot, and then sends a position packet.

Parameters:
x - X location on the map (0-16384)
y - Y location on the map (0-16384)
xVel - Velocity along the x axis (# pixels across x every 10 seconds)
yVel - Velocity along the y axis (# pixels across y every 10 seconds)

move

public void move(int x,
                 int y)
Essentially a low-level warp. Sets x and y coords of the bot, sets the x and y velocities to 0 (stopped), and then sends a position packet. Note that because this stops the bot dead in its tracks, it will revert position data updates to the time specified in m_unmovingUpdateTime. When this occurs, it may result in the appearance of the bot 'shifting' back and forth badly between a predicted position and a sent position.

Parameters:
x - X location on the map (0-16384)
y - Y location on the map (0-16384)

moveAndFire

public void moveAndFire(int x,
                        int y,
                        int weapon)
Similar to move(int, int) except that it also causes the ship to fire the specified weapon.

Parameters:
x - X location on the map (0-16384)
y - Y location on the map (0-16384)
weapon - 16-bit bitvector containing weapon information
See Also:
getWeaponNumber(byte, byte, boolean, boolean, boolean, byte, boolean)

setVelocitiesAndDir

public void setVelocitiesAndDir(int xVel,
                                int yVel,
                                int direction)
Sets velocity of x and y, and the direction the ship is facing, and then sends a position packet.

Parameters:
xVel - Velocity along the x axis (# pixels across x every 10 seconds)
yVel - Velocity along the y axis (# pixels across y every 10 seconds)
direction - Direction to face ship in Subspace degrees (0-39)

setRotation

public void setRotation(int rotation)
Sets direction the ship is facing, in Subspace degrees. SS directions: 0 - Left 10 - Up 20 - Right 30 - Down

Parameters:
rotation - Direction to face ship in Subspace degrees (0-39)

rotateRadians

public void rotateRadians(double rads)
Sets direction the ship is facing, in radians.

Parameters:
rads - Radian direction to face ship

rotateDegrees

public void rotateDegrees(int degrees)
Sets direction the ship is facing, in degrees (1-360)

Parameters:
degrees - Direction the ship is facing, in degrees

setShip

public void setShip(int shipType)
Sets ship type from 0-8. 0 is warbird. If set to 8, the bot will become a spectator, and cease sending any kind of position packet. (Yes, TWCore's spec ship is normally 0. This is not the way the SS protocol normally handles it, however.)

Parameters:
shipType - Type of ship to set to (1-8 in-game, 0 spectator)

setFreq

public void setFreq(int freq)
Sets the freq of the bot.

Parameters:
freq - Freq to set to

attach

public void attach(int playerId)
Sets the bot to attach to a specific player.

Parameters:
playerId - ID to attach to

unattach

public void unattach()
Sets the bot to detach from whomever it is currently attached to.

setMovingUpdateTime

public void setMovingUpdateTime(int updateTime)
Sets the time between position packet updates for when the bot is moving.

Parameters:
updateTime - Time in ms between position packets while in movement

setUnmovingUpdateTime

public void setUnmovingUpdateTime(int updateTime)
Sets the time between position packet updates for when the bot is not moving.

Parameters:
updateTime - Time in ms between position packets while stopped

getX

public short getX()
Returns:
Current x coordinate

getY

public short getY()
Returns:
Current y coordinate

getShip

public short getShip()
Returns:
Ship type (0-7 in-game, 8 spec'd)

getDirection

public short getDirection()
Returns:
Direction ship is facing, in SS degrees (0-39)

getWeaponNumber

public int getWeaponNumber(byte weaponType,
                           byte weaponLevel,
                           boolean bouncing,
                           boolean isEMP,
                           boolean isBomb,
                           byte shrap,
                           boolean alternate)
Returns a weapon number as used by the SS protocol based on information provided.

Parameters:
weaponType - Type of weapon (0-15)
weaponLevel - Level of weapon (0-15)
bouncing - True for a bouncing effect
isEMP - True if weapon causes EMP damage
isBomb - True if weapon is a bomb
shrap - Amount of shrap (0-15)
alternate - Unknown
Returns:
An int bitvector representing the weapon specified

getAge

public int getAge()
Returns:
Time in ms since last position update (regardless of packet sent or not)

getMovingUpdateTime

public int getMovingUpdateTime()
Returns:
Interval in ms between position packet sendings while ship is moving

getUnmovingUpdateTime

public int getUnmovingUpdateTime()
Returns:
Interval in ms between position packet sendings while ship is moving
